server.net

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • server.net.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    The workhorse of the Server backend, the ClientHandler is the class that almost exclusively talks to the client. It implements an atomic style of threading. See the thicck paragraph on the Server doc for more informaion.
    Author:
    Michael Ferolito

      • check

        public void check()
        Ensures the ClientHandler is not null. A similar process may be achieved by using Unsafe to check for initialized instances.

      • sendEvent

        public void sendEvent(ExecutionEvent e)
        Deprecated. since version 2
        Parameters:
        e -

      • hit

        public void hit()
        CliencHandlers hold the Hp of the player. This causes the hp to decrease. It kills the player if the HP is less than or equal to 0;

      • processEvents

        public void processEvents()
        Should be overridden in subclasses. Provides infastructure for handling events drawn from the queues that do not need to be immediately dealt with.
